cotton_leaf_spot.name: Cotton Leaf Spot
cotton_leaf_spot.description: Cotton leaf spot is characterized by small, circular spots on leaves that can lead to defoliation if left untreated. The disease is caused by the fungus Alternaria macrospora.

recommended_pesticides.name: Mancozeb
recommended_pesticides.description: Broad-spectrum fungicide that prevents spore germination. Apply at 2-3 kg/ha.

recommended_pesticides.name: Propiconazole
recommended_pesticides.description: Systemic fungicide that stops fungal growth. Apply at 500-750 ml/ha.

cotton_boll_rot.name: Cotton Boll Rot
cotton_boll_rot.description: Cotton boll rot causes discoloration and decay of cotton bolls, leading to significant yield losses. It's typically caused by various fungi including Diplodia, Fusarium, and Colletotrichum species.

recommended_pesticides.name: Carbendazim
recommended_pesticides.description: Systemic fungicide effective against boll rot. Apply at 500g/ha.

recommended_pesticides.name: Chlorothalonil
recommended_pesticides.description: Protectant fungicide with multi-site activity. Apply at 1.5-2 kg/ha.

coconut_leaf_spot.name: Coconut Leaf Spot
coconut_leaf_spot.description: Coconut leaf spot disease appears as grayish-brown spots with yellow halos on leaves. It's caused by the fungus Pestalotiopsis palmarum and can reduce photosynthetic capacity.

recommended_pesticides.name: Copper Oxychloride
recommended_pesticides.description: Contact fungicide effective against leaf spot. Apply at 3g/liter of water.

recommended_pesticides.name: Hexaconazole
recommended_pesticides.description: Systemic fungicide that provides protective and curative action. Apply at 1ml/liter of water.

coconut_bud_rot.name: Coconut Bud Rot
coconut_bud_rot.description: Coconut bud rot is a serious disease affecting the terminal bud of coconut palms, causing yellowing and wilting of youngest leaves. It's primarily caused by the fungus Phytophthora palmivora.

recommended_pesticides.name: Metalaxyl
recommended_pesticides.description: Systemic fungicide specific for Phytophthora control. Apply as a root drench at 2g/liter of water.

recommended_pesticides.name: Fosetyl-Aluminum
recommended_pesticides.description: Systemic fungicide that triggers plant defense mechanisms. Apply at 3g/liter of water as a foliar spray.

generic_disease.name: Generic Crop Disease
generic_disease.description: Unidentified crop disease showing general symptoms of plant stress. This could be due to a variety of pathogens or environmental factors.

recommended_pesticides.name: General Fungicide Mix
recommended_pesticides.description: Broad-spectrum fungicide combination effective against multiple pathogens. Apply as per manufacturer's recommendations.

recommended_pesticides.name: Biological Control Agent
recommended_pesticides.description: Contains beneficial microorganisms like Trichoderma spp. that compete with pathogens. Apply as a soil drench or foliar spray.
